net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.rtsp

Class RtspClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.rtsp.RtspClient

  • public class RtspClient
extends java.lang.Object
    RFC 2326. A basic and synchronous RTSP client. The original purpose of this class was to implement a small RTSP client compatible with Wowza. It implements Digest Access Authentication according to RFC 2069.

      • setSession

        public void setSession(Session session)
        The Session that will be used to stream to the server. If not called before startStream(int), a it will be created.

      • getSession

      • setServerAddress

        public void setServerAddress(java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
        Sets the destination address of the RTSP server.
        Parameters:
        host - The destination address
        port - The destination port

      • setCredentials

        public void setCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        If authentication is enabled on the server, you need to call this with a valid username/password pair. Only implements Digest Access Authentication according to RFC 2069.
        Parameters:
        username - The username
        password - The password

      • setStreamPath

        public void setStreamPath(java.lang.String path)
        The path to which the stream will be sent to.
        Parameters:
        path - The path

      • isStreaming

        public boolean isStreaming()

      • startStream

        public void startStream(int retries)
                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.net.UnknownHostException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Connects to the RTSP server to publish the stream, and the effectively starts streaming. You need to call setServerAddress(String, int) and optionnally setSession(Session) and setCredentials(String, String) before calling this. Should be called of the main thread !
        Parameters:
        retries - The number of retries that will be
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if wrong credentials have been provided, or if an error occurs with Session.start()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if setServerAddress(String, int) was never called, if the server requires authentication of the client, or if an error occurs with Session.start()
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown if the hostname specified with setServerAddress(String, int) can't be resolved
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs with Session.start()

      • stopStream

        public void stopStream()
        Stops the stream, and informs the RTSP server.
